results.title: 4 years-6 years = Four years to six years
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Dorothy Courtois, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Child”.
By the age of four the child is curious about the world around him. To find out, he is asking thousands of questions. He is also learning not to be afraid. This film shows children in learning situations: on a nature hike; handling animals and other creatures; dealing with their peers. One particularly interesting example is that of Ingrid and Helen, twins who look alike but act differently.

results.title: 4 Shorts by Werner Herzog
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog Filmproduktion, Werner Herzog and Walter Saxer
results.brief_description: A compilation of four short documentary films by Werner Herzog, dubbed one of the most eccentric characters in New German Cinema. “How much would a woodchuck chuck”: An offbeat documentary on the annual World Championship of Livestock Auctioneers in the Amish region of Pennsylvania’s Lancaster County. “Woodchuck” includes a series of hilarious interviews showing the complex tongue-twisters, breathing exercises and secret signals used by the contestants. “La Soufriere”: A record of an ardent and unfulfilled journey to the island of Guadaloupe by the director and two cameramen, to see the eruption of volcano La Soufriere. Once there, they find the population has fled before poisonous gas emissions and tremors, save for three men who have stayed to await their impending deaths. The volcano subsides and Herzog withdraws unrequited. “The Great ecstacy of Woodcarver Steiner”: This film studies Walter Steiner, a woodcarver and one of the leading championship ski jumpers in the world. Herzog follows Steiner’s preparation for the Championships in Yugoslavia, setting up cameras on giant ramps to slow down the action by twenty times. “The Flying doctors of East Africa”: An absorbing documentary on the work of an independent group of physicians in remote areas of East Africa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Werner Herzog Filmproduktion, Werner Herzog and Walter Saxer

results.title: 4 rooms: earth view
results.brief_description: The story of the three missions, the nine astronauts and their 171 days in the manned laboratory. Criss-crossing 70 per cent of Earth’s land area, Skylab’s sensors gathered information about many features of the planet.

results.title: 4 aventures de Reinette et Mirabelle = 4 adventures of Reinette and Mirabelle
results.brief_description:
A friendship between two teenage girls who share a flat: Reinette, a country girl who wants to become a painter and Mirabelle, a Parisian student. The four ‘adventures’, in the countryside and then in Paris, reveal the girls’ differing reactions to nature, social injustice, money and the subject invariably at the centre of Rohmer’s films, talk itself.

Credits: Producer, Margaret Menegoz ; director, writer, Eric Rohmer ; photography, Sophie Maintigneux ; editor, Maria-Luisa Garcia ; music, Ronan Girre, Jean-Louis Valero.
Cast: Philippe Laudenbach, Marie Riviere, Fabrice Luchini, Joelle Miquel, Jessica Forde.

results.title: 3rd Ave El = Third Avenue El
results.brief_description: A dizzying, poetic ride through the city on an elevated railway that today exists only in memory. The El was noisy, ponderous and rickety - a leftover from earlier times, but by exploring the train, its passengers, movements, colours and images we find that it had its own unique beauty.

results.title: 36: Le Grand Tournant
results.creator_credit: Albina du Boisrouvray and Henri de Turenne
results.brief_description:
Through newsreel and archival footage this documentary evokes the great demonstrations on February 1934 in Paris and the rise of the ‘Front Populaire’ movement.

Credits: Producer, Albina du Boisrouvray ; director, Henri de Turenne ; writers, Jean Francois Revel, Pierre Hadrien ; music, Jean Pierre Bourtayre.
Cast: Serge Reggiani [narration].

results.title: 36 Fillette
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Emmanuel Schlumberger, Valerie Seydoux and Catherine Breillat
results.brief_description: The title refers to a child’s dress size, which the film’s heroine, Lili, has unmistakably outgrown. A sullen, uncommunicative 14 year old vacationing with her family in Biarritz, Lili is clearly ready to strike out on her own. She does so by dressing up in jeans, a corset and a raincoat, then hitching a ride to the local nightclub in search of adventure. Not surprisingly, adventure comes her way! “36 Fillette”, written and directed by French novelist Catherine Breillat, is based on one of her novels.
